rules.natural: If the government provides funding for wetland research, then the wetland ecosystem achieves conservation
Either the government provides funding for wetland research or the private sector provides funding for wetland research

Either the regulatory agency approves development in the industrial zone, or if the regulatory agency triggers a review of wetland policy then the regulatory agency designates the wetland region as a protected area
If the environmental group identifies a threat to endangered species, then the regulatory agency does not approve development in the industrial zone
Either the environmental group identifies a threat to endangered species or the environmental group documents contamination in water sources
If the environmental group documents contamination in water sources, then the regulatory agency does not approve development in the industrial zone
If the university team conducts a study on hydrological patterns, then if the private sector provides funding for wetland research, the wetland ecosystem achieves conservation
Either the university team conducts a study on hydrological patterns or the consulting firm conducts a study on hydrological patterns
If the consulting firm conducts a study on hydrological patterns, then if the private sector provides funding for wetland research, the wetland ecosystem achieves conservation
If the research team develops a flood prediction model, then the research team validates the flood prediction model
If the research team submits a report to the regulatory agency, then the regulatory agency triggers a review of wetland policy
If the regulatory agency triggers a review of wetland policy, then the regulatory agency implements restrictions on development activities
If the research team does not publish findings in a peer-reviewed journal and the wetland ecosystem does not achieve conservation, then the research team submits a report to the regulatory agency
If the wetland ecosystem does not achieve conservation, then the research team develops a flood prediction model

facts.natural: The regulatory agency does not implement restrictions on development activities
The regulatory agency does not designate the wetland region as a protected area
The research team does not validate the flood prediction model
The research team does not publish findings in a peer-reviewed journal

steps.natural: If the private sector provides funding for wetland research, then the wetland ecosystem achieves conservation
The research team does not develop a flood prediction model
The regulatory agency does not trigger a review of wetland policy

Either the research team publishes findings in a peer-reviewed journal or the wetland ecosystem achieves conservation
The regulatory agency does not approve development in the industrial zone
If the regulatory agency triggers a review of wetland policy, then the regulatory agency designates the wetland region as a protected area
The regulatory agency does not trigger a review of wetland policy
The research team does not submit a report to the regulatory agency
Either the research team publishes findings in a peer-reviewed journal or the wetland ecosystem achieves conservation

natural_facts.A12: The regulatory agency approves development in the industrial zone

(A1 → G).natural: If the government provides funding for wetland research, then the wetland ecosystem achieves conservation

(A1 ∨ A2).natural: Either the government provides funding for wetland research or the private sector provides funding for wetland research

(A12 ∨ (A9 → A11)).natural: Either the regulatory agency approves development in the industrial zone, or if the regulatory agency triggers a review of wetland policy then the regulatory agency designates the wetland region as a protected area

(A13 → ¬A12).natural: If the environmental group identifies a threat to endangered species, then the regulatory agency does not approve development in the industrial zone

(A13 ∨ A14).natural: Either the environmental group identifies a threat to endangered species or the environmental group documents contamination in water sources

(A14 → ¬A12).natural: If the environmental group documents contamination in water sources, then the regulatory agency does not approve development in the industrial zone

(A2 → G).natural: If the private sector provides funding for wetland research, then the wetland ecosystem achieves conservation

(A3 → (A2 → G)).natural: If the university team conducts a study on hydrological patterns, then if the private sector provides funding for wetland research, the wetland ecosystem achieves conservation

(A3 ∨ A4).natural: Either the university team conducts a study on hydrological patterns or the consulting firm conducts a study on hydrological patterns

(A4 → (A2 → G)).natural: If the consulting firm conducts a study on hydrological patterns, then if the private sector provides funding for wetland research, the wetland ecosystem achieves conservation

(A5 → A6).natural: If the research team develops a flood prediction model, then the research team validates the flood prediction model

(A7 ∨ G).natural: Either the research team publishes findings in a peer-reviewed journal or the wetland ecosystem achieves conservation

(A8 → A9).natural: If the research team submits a report to the regulatory agency, then the regulatory agency triggers a review of wetland policy

(A9 → A10).natural: If the regulatory agency triggers a review of wetland policy, then the regulatory agency implements restrictions on development activities

(A9 → A11).natural: If the regulatory agency triggers a review of wetland policy, then the regulatory agency designates the wetland region as a protected area

(¬(A7 ∨ G) → A8).natural: If the research team does not publish findings in a peer-reviewed journal and the wetland ecosystem does not achieve conservation, then the research team submits a report to the regulatory agency

(¬G → A5).natural: If the wetland ecosystem does not achieve conservation, then the research team develops a flood prediction model
